intro: Teucrium affine var. dentosum, commonly known as the toothed germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features slender, branched stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, giving the plant its characteristic "toothed" appearance. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and are arranged in loose spikes along the stems. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas.
